title: APG Editable Combobox With List Autocomplete Example
description: This is a test of the Aria Authoring Practices Editable Combobox With List Autocomplete Example

was implied by its absence. When expanded, Narrator announces "suggestions available".

input is echoed back ("n", "e"). "suggestions available" is announced when the list box is expanded.

results.notes: combobox can open a list or grid, so the role is important
not implied by listbox context since the listbox role is not conveyed. Could be an option or a grid cell.
Partial because Narrator switched to scan mode, and is no longer respecting the activedescendant. However, if you manually exit scan mode, activedescendant works as expected.

edge.output: each option was conveyed. After last option was conveyed, the cursor exited the listbox, but the end boundary was conveyed.

results.notes: boundaries implied by position in set information
partial because Narrator stayed in scan mode and did not respect activedescendant. However, if you manually exit scan mode, activedescendant works as expected.

combobox role was implied by the "collapsed" state + "edit box" role. It could be argued that the combobox role was not conveyed, because the "collapsed" state is a result of aria-expanded rather than the combobox role. However, the absence of an explicit announcement for the combobox role likely will not prevent end users from understanding the combobox behavior of the control because the collapsed state is conveyed along with the text input role.
value is blank

history.message: Added Narrator results for NVDA and JAWS, updated NVDA+Chrome results.
Updated VoiceOver tests to illustrate a bug where aria-activedescendant is not respected when the combobox input has no value.
Updated results. Support was largely similar to when it was last tested, except that both VoiceOver for MacOS and Talkback for Android appear to have lost support for options within a listbox.
